description.en: Theoretical approaches of history of scientific ideas such as contextualism, realism, relativism, externalism, internalism, etc, will be introduced. Some of the most significant examples of European scientific ideas such as geo- and heliocentric cosmology, Newtonian revolution in science, alchemy and chemistry, the Enlightenment and scientific ideas, evolutionary ideas, history of ideas about the nature of human beings and ideas about society will be analysed from different theoretical perspectives.
description.et: Kursuse käigus tutvutakse ideedeajaloo teoreetiliste lähenemistega nagu kontekstualism, realism, relativism, eksternalism, internalism jt ning analüüsitakse Euroopa teaduslike ideede ajaloo olulisemaid näiteid nagu üleminek müüdiliselt mõtlemiselt teaduslikule, geotsentriline ja heliotsentriline maailmapilt, njuutonlik pööre ja tänapäevase teaduse tekkimine, alkeemia ja keemia, valgustusideed ja teadus, evolutsiooniideed, näiteid  inimese- ja ühiskonnakäsitluste ajaloost.

objectives.en:
To provide the students with an overview of the evolution of scientific ideas in Europe, 
to introduce theoretical approaches and methods used in the studies of history of scientific ideas,
to develop the students' analytic skills, as well as those of academic writing and oral presentation.
objectives.et: Anda ülevaade teaduslike ideede arengust Euroopas, tutvustada teaduslike ideede ideeajaloolise käsitlemise teoreetilisi aluseid ja meetodeid, arendada tekstianalüüsi, akadeemilise kirjutamise ja suulise esinemise oskusi.

learning_outcomes.en: On successful completion of the course the students:
-	Know theoretical approaches and research methods for the study of history of scientific ideas;
learning_outcomes.et: -	tunneb peamisi ideedeajaloo uurimismeetodeid ja teoreetilisi lähenemisi,

learning_outcomes.en: -	Are familiar with some historical examples and can analyse particular cases;
learning_outcomes.et: -	tunneb mõningaid olulisemaid ajaloolisi näiteid ja oskab neid analüüsida,

learning_outcomes.en: -	Are able to present results of their analysis and have obtained necessary skills of academic writing.
learning_outcomes.et: -	oskab esitleda oma analüüsitulemusi ja evib selleks vajalikke akadeemilise kirjutamise oskusi.

notes.et: More detailed information, guidelines, schedules, etc are available on Moodle. Some seminars may occur in Zoom.

independent_work.et: To complete the course students are supposed to write an essay after the first six seminars and submit it for discussion, and by the end of the course another essay will have to be submitted, also discussed in the seminar. Guidelines for writing are available in Moodle. An essay meeting all the requirements gives 40% of the final grade, two essays together 80%. 20% of the grade is based on the students' seminar participation.

description.et: During the course, two essays are to be submitted. The first of those has to be submitted by April 1, 2024.  The essay will be discussed orally in the seminar on April 3, and graded only after the seminar discussion.
The deadline of the second essay is on May 27, 2024. Seminar discussion will be on May 29, grades after the seminar.

grade_preconditions.et: Seminar assignments make up 20% of the grade and two essays during the course together give 80%. To be accepted for grading, one has to participate at least in ten seminars of the twelve. Missed classes/webinars can be compensated by a written assignment.

debt_elimination.et: Two missed classes is allowed, from the third one has to submit a written assignment.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
